alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Milwaukee; Racine (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 8:23PM CDT until March 31 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Milwaukee County in southeastern Wisconsin... Northeastern Racine County in southeastern Wisconsin... Eastern Kenosha County in southeastern Wisconsin... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 823 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oconomowoc to near Wind Lake to Fox Lake, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Milwaukee, Kenosha, Racine, West Allis, Wauwatosa, Greenfield, Oak Creek, Mount Pleasant, South Milwaukee, Pleasant Prairie, Cudahy, Greendale, St. Francis, Hales Corners, Sturtevant, Union Grove, West Milwaukee, Franklin, Raymond, and Yorkville. This includes the following Locations Boerner Botanical Gardens, General Mitchell International Airport, Froedert & the Medical College, and Fiserv Forum. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Wisconsin. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Wisconsin.
